name: Free Democracy Now! for Android
tagline: This application parses the Democracy Now! rss feed
body:
### Watch Democracy Now! Democracy Now! is an independent daily news broadcast (licensed under creative commons). They refer to themselves as "the War and Peace Report." Democracy Now! is a wonderful alternative to main stream media.
### Free Democracy Now! This application parses the Democracy Now (democracynow.org) rss. There is a non-free democracy Now! application on the google play store, and so I wrote this. Although this has less features, there are some positives: the videos aren't downloaded to the device (and sucking up memory) but streamed through the browser or VLC (I use VLC). Unlike the un-free version, this application doesn't stream audio. I'm using the SimplisticRss library by ShirwaM, modified to get the video url.
#### What todo? There a little bug, when you adjust the system volume the video crashes (use VLC's volume adjuster instead).

TODO:

Add podcast/audio function
Play video in its own activity? I have a mock up for this, but nothing as advanced as the non-free's version. Maybe VLC is just simpler AND better.
